postsData.name:
Becca Chambers ✨
Becca Chambers ✨
postsData.content:
Another sign of how tough the job market is right now?

So many people I know won’t even apply to jobs unless they have an internal reference or someone to make an intro for them.

Jobs they’re not only qualified for—but genuinely excited about.



And they’re not wrong, either.

As I’ve been searching for my next full-time role, I’ve found myself doing the exact same thing.

I’ll see an interesting job, and if I don’t know someone who works there, the first thing I do is check LinkedIn to see if I’m connected to anyone who can refer me to someone who does.

If I can’t make the connection, I move on. I don’t even apply—to roles I’d crush.



It’s not because I’m a quitter. It’s because when there are 1,500 applicants for VP or C-level roles, it feels almost impossible to stand out.

And that’s incredibly depressing because it means:

1️⃣ Job seekers are too discouraged to even apply to roles they’d thrive in.

2️⃣ Companies are missing out on incredible talent because people feel like their resumes will disappear into a black hole.

Lose-lose.



What can job seekers do in this reality when they find a job they’re a great fit for but don’t have a connection—besides skipping over opportunities they’d typically pursue?

If you’re like me, you double down and reach out to *every corner* of your network:

️ Leverage 2nd-degree connections. Find someone in your network who can introduce you to an employee at the company. Many companies offer great incentives for referrals, so even folks who don’t know you personally may be happy to refer you.

️ Use LinkedIn’s “People” search feature. Identify employees at the company and send personalized connection requests. Mention the role you’re excited about, and ask if they’d be open to a quick chat about their experience there. Genuine curiosity can go a long way.

️ Reach out directly to the hiring manager. Send a note explaining why you’d be a great fit and what excites you about the role. As someone who’s hired for many positions, I can tell you that a thoughtful, personality-filled message that’s relevant to the role will absolutely stand out.



The crappy reality is that in today’s market, your network really is everything—no matter how amazing you are at your job—so lean on it AND keep building it.

(And while not the focus of this post, this also underscores the importance of building your personal brand—now more than ever.)

Good luck out there, jobseekers. I feel your pain. This market is unlike anything else.

William (Wil) Klusovsky yep. Same! And even sometimes with a reference, I’d get an auto-rejection before even a screener call—make it make sense!
William (Wil) Klusovsky Networking is the key. Networking is the key. Networking is the key…..
Bang on! If you're not walked into the interview process, don't bother. That seems to be the message, sadly. So the question begs: how valuable is LinkedIn as a job board resource?

Chris Heinemann it’s still the best way to network, no question. So that alone makes it valuable. Hiring game is definitely changing, I hope someone is able to come disrupt that market in a positive way.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely! Leveraging your network is key in today’s market. Its all about connections. Lets keep supporting each other! 💪 #JobSearch #Networking

postsData.content:
𝐘𝐨𝐮 𝐀𝐬𝐤𝐞𝐝 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐅𝐞𝐞𝐝𝐛𝐚𝐜𝐤... 𝐍𝐨𝐰 𝐖𝐡𝐚𝐭? 
Let’s face it: asking for criticism sounds brave. But how you react to that criticism? That’s the real test of character (and your sense of humor).

Here’s the thing: The way you ask for feedback and react to it can either build trust or burn bridges faster than a bad stock tip.

 Don’t Be That Person:

1️⃣ The "Fishing for Compliments" Critic Seeker
You ask for feedback but only expect praise. When someone points out a real flaw, suddenly it's, "Oh, that's just your opinion!"
2️⃣ The "Defensive Defender"
Someone gives thoughtful criticism, and you jump into "No, but let me explain why you’re wrong" mode. (Pro tip: Don’t.)
3️⃣ The Vanisher
You ask for feedback and disappear the moment it gets uncomfortable. Ghosting isn’t for professional relationships!

 How to Nail It:

1️⃣ Be Clear About What You Want
Instead of "What do you think?" try, "Can you tell me how this could be better?"
2️⃣ Listen Without Arguing
Yes, it stings. Yes, it’s awkward. But stay quiet, take notes, and save the rebuttals for your imaginary shower arguments later.
3️⃣ Show Gratitude (Even If You’re Crying Inside)
"Thank you for your honesty!" is a lot more productive than "You just don’t get my genius."

Why It Matters:

Reacting well to feedback doesn’t just make you seem more professional—it builds trust. When people see you can handle tough truths without throwing tantrums, they’re more likely to:

Respect your leadership.
Trust you with more responsibility.
Tell you when your PowerPoint font choices are actually horrible.

 Remember:

Feedback isn’t personal—it’s like spinach. You might not love it, but it’s good for you (and everyone will notice if you keep avoiding it).

 What’s the best—or worst—reaction to criticism you’ve ever seen? Let’s laugh or learn in the comments!

comments.commentText: It's common to fall into the trap of seeking only praise, but feedback, especially constructive criticism, is where real value lies. Once we receive the feedback, resist the urge to be defensive. No one likes to hear they're not perfect but listening attentively without arguing shows maturity and a willingness to learn (active listening!!). It's tough, but embracing criticism as a tool for improvement is key.

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Embracing feedback can truly transform our growth. Let’s keep the conversation going—what tips do others have for handling criticism?

How do great Project Managers succeed? 

They connect, adapt, and deliver value.

Project management isn’t just about tasks,

it’s about aligning goals with stakeholder needs.

Here’s how you can lead with impact:

1️⃣ Speak Their Language

Executives care about ROI, risk, and timelines.
Example: Highlight how a new feature saves $100K annually.
End-users focus on functionality and workflows.

Example: Show how an updated process reduces their workload.
Vendors want clear milestones and deliverables.
Example: Share specific deadlines and expectations upfront.

2️⃣ Tailor Communication

Avoid jargon; simplify complex ideas.
Example: Instead of “improved infrastructure scalability,” say “it handles 3x more users now.”

Emphasize what matters to each group.
Example: For executives, lead with key metrics; for end-users, explain benefits in daily tasks.

3️⃣ Foster Trust Through Action

Stay transparent and deliver consistently.
Example: Provide regular updates and address issues before they escalate.
Show that their input matters.

Example: Incorporate feedback from end-users into the final product.

4️⃣ Drive Alignment

Connect everyone to the shared goal.

Example: “Here’s how your work contributes to the company saving $500K this year.”

Great PMs don’t just manage,
they inspire.

When you adapt, connect, and deliver value, you turn projects into success stories.

Drop a ️ if you like this post.
Let me know your thoughts in the comments.

comments.commentText: Great project managers succeed by prioritizing clarity and empathy. Aligning stakeholders, simplifying communication, and delivering consistent results create trust and drive outcomes. A focus on shared goals is what truly inspires teams to excel.

Nerea Arregui Exposito So accurate!!
All the things you mentioned are on point.

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights on project management! Adapting communication and fostering trust truly transform how we lead projects. #Inspiration #Leadership

I hope that, with the release of DeepSeek R1, and its proven capabilities to beat ChatGPT on many tasks, we will go back to using deep research to continue to make LLMs better, instead of hyping it up with superficial buzzwords.

Here’s an awesome openbook from Tong Xiao and Jingbo Zhu that I think will help people leverage First Principle Thinking to breakdown complex problems that exist today with LLMs, into smaller digestible gaps, so they can redesign or rebuild from the ground up.

This is what makes AI cheaper long-term and more accessible to everyone. Race to the bottom is a natural course of technology.

Foundations of Large Language Models explores basics concepts of LLMs such as:

Pre-Training methods and model architectures
Building models and scaling to train
Prompting strategies, like chain-of-thought
Alignment methods, like RLHF

Do enjoy this one! Looking forward to seeing how researchers continue to disrupt the status quo!

postsData.commentAdded: Excited for DeepSeek R1s potential! Diving deep into LLM research is key for meaningful advancements. Thanks for sharing this resource!

postsData.content:
This year, the winds of change are undeniable. From Prime Minister Modi’s inspiring address to the groundbreaking innovations at the Bharat Mobility Auto Expo, electric mobility has truly stepped into the spotlight. However, Internal Combustion Engines (ICE) continue to play a crucial role in the journey toward a sustainable future. It’s about embracing innovations from both worlds to build a more sustainable and balanced mobility landscape.

The luxury of choice has never been more real. Whether you're drawn to the cutting-edge technology of electric vehicles (EVs) or you still value the reliability and performance of ICE, there is an option for every kind of driver, every kind of family, and every kind of vision. The future is about leveraging the strengths of both ICE and EVs to create a cleaner, more efficient mobility ecosystem.

At Mahindra, we not just showcased our recently launched ICE models XUV3XO & Thar Roxx, but also the BE6 and XEV 09—our electric origin models, for the very first time to public, that captivated the crowd and set the stage for a future where electric vehicles are not just an aspiration but an accessible reality.

The atmosphere at the Bharat Mobility Auto Expo was electric—our pavilion was buzzing with excitement, as the BE6 and XEV 09 turned heads and sparked conversations. It was inspiring to witness how the industry is evolving and how quickly electric mobility is becoming a reality. And while electric is accelerating forward, ICE continues to evolve, bringing smarter and more eco-friendly solutions to the table.

Innovation knows no boundaries—whether it's breakthroughs in battery technology for EVs or enhancing the efficiency of ICE through cleaner emissions and next-gen technologies, the commitment to advancing both remains steadfast. By driving innovation across both domains, a sustainable and impactful transition is within reach.

With government support, corporate partnerships, and a collective push from the entire industry, a future is being built where electric and ICE vehicles coexist, working in tandem to power a greener, more sustainable tomorrow.

The future is about progress, choice, and balance!

Let’s continue to shape the future, embracing both the power of EV innovation and the enduring capabilities of ICE.

Points Programs Are Dead. 

Paid Loyalty Is the Future.

Is your loyalty program driving loyalty at all?

Our clients—and the data—tell a clear story: traditional points programs are fading.

Consumers today want more than the promise of future rewards.
They want real value NOW, and they’re willing to pay for it.

Amazon Prime, Walmart+, Uber One, and others know what works:

 Exclusive perks that make members feel like VIPs.
 Faster services that meet today’s demand for speed.
 Personalized benefits that deepen connections.
 Cost savings that are clear and measurable.

Clients who replaced their points programs with paid memberships saw a 25% increase in ARR and dramatically higher customer engagement.

Why? Because when customers invest, they engage more. They spend with you first, before considering alternatives.

Building loyalty requires your customers to have “skin in the game.”

It’s time to shift.

postsData.name:
Gary Shapiro
Gary Shapiro
postsData.content:
President Trump’s executive orders and announcements cutting government DEI actions and sidelining DEI employees have me flummoxed. On the one hand, I think diversity is a vital part of our national recipe for success. Making employees feel welcome and included in the workplace makes human and business sense. On the other hand, we have to cut government spending and ensure hiring is based on competence above all else.

I was thinking about this as I read a Substack post by marketing genius, who wrote about his experience being mistaken for superstar Jackie Chan. For several years in the 90s I kept hearing how much I looked like Al Gore, which I think is far less of a compliment!

Guy’s piece highlights a fundamental human challenge: we tend to make snap judgments about people. Too often, we tend to gravitate towards people who look like us. That’s just how we as humans evolved – it was a survival skill.

Sadly, it can have a major downside. In the tech world, VCs and other people with money tend to be most comfortable investing in those that look like them. That means most tech investment dollars go to companies headed by white and Asian men, and companies on the coasts.

At CTA, we believe that good ideas can come from anyone, anywhere. (And I saw it again and again in Eureka Park, our home for startups at CES, meeting founders and entrepreneurs leading some of the 1400 startups.) Venture capital access shouldn’t just be about who you know, who you went to school with, or where you live.

That’s why we created our Innovation for All Fund, which invests in the VC firms funding founder teams of women, people of color, veterans, and other underrepresented entrepreneurs. To date, we’ve invested $10 million through the Innovation for All Fund, and at
, we announced plans to invest $5 million more. We’re trying to expand the pool of opportunity!

comments.commentText: Good balanced perspective on this topic Gary that unlike the majority DOES have a role on LI.

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Fostering diversity enhances innovation. Excited to see how the Innovation for All Fund continues to expand opportunity!

postsData.content:
Why Employees Leave: It’s Not Always About the Paycheck 

The truth? People don’t just leave jobs—they leave environments that don’t serve them.

When great employees walk away, it’s rarely due to a lack of effort or loyalty. It’s about the culture, leadership, and support they didn’t receive.

 What’s Driving People Away?

1️⃣ Toxic Atmosphere
Negativity spreads fast, leaving employees emotionally drained.
2️⃣ Burnout Central
Expecting endless effort without balance leads to exhaustion, not excellence.
3️⃣ Weak Leadership
Leaders who micromanage or lack vision create frustration, not inspiration.
4️⃣ No Growth Path
Without opportunities to learn and advance, even motivated employees lose their spark.
5️⃣ Unfair Compensation
When pay doesn’t reflect effort, it’s hard to stay motivated.
6️⃣ Work-Life Chaos
A job that demands your personal time is a recipe for dissatisfaction.
7️⃣ No Appreciation
Hard work without recognition? That’s a fast track to feeling undervalued.
8️⃣ Creativity Blocked
Rigid rules that stifle innovation make passionate employees lose interest.

 Key Takeaways:

️ Build a culture of respect and transparency.
️ Recognize and reward effort—big or small.
️ Prioritize balance and mental health to avoid burnout.
️ Empower employees to innovate and grow.

 Want to retain your top talent? Focus on creating an environment where they feel valued, supported, and inspired. Let’s make workplaces a space people love showing up to!

The 3 positive signals you know:

3. General Clicks
↳ Every click boosts engagement

4. View Time
↳ The longer it is, the better

5. New Connections
↳ Two weeks of boosted content

↳ Off-platform shares help your reach
□ Not sure how to influence this one...

Content creation is the game.

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗰𝗲𝗽𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗹𝗴𝗼𝗿𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗺: 𝗔 𝗖𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗶𝗰 𝗙𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗠𝗼𝗱𝗲𝗿𝗻 𝗠𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴

The Perceptron Algorithm was the first-ever machine learning model proposed for classification tasks, marking a pivotal moment in the evolution of AI. While it comes with limitations, its simplicity and intuitiveness make it an essential concept for anyone stepping into the world of machine learning. Here’s why it remains relevant:

𝗖𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗽𝘁 𝗼𝗳 𝗖𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: The Perceptron introduces the fundamental idea of separating data into classes using a linear decision boundary.
𝗕𝘂𝗶𝗹𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗕𝗹𝗼𝗰𝗸 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗔𝗱𝘃𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗱 𝗠𝗼𝗱𝗲𝗹𝘀: It forms the conceptual basis for understanding modern algorithms like Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, and Neural Networks.
𝗛𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗶𝗴𝗻𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲: As the starting point of supervised learning, it demonstrates how AI has evolved from simple rules to sophisticated models.
𝗨𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗟𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗘𝘃𝗼𝗹𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: Studying the Perceptron highlights challenges such as its inability to handle non-linearly separable data, which inspired the development of more powerful algorithms.

Whether you're new to machine learning or deepening your expertise, revisiting the Perceptron Algorithm helps connect foundational principles to cutting-edge innovations in the field.

𝘚𝘵𝘢𝘺 𝘶𝘱𝘥𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘮𝘰𝘳𝘦 𝘴𝘶𝘤𝘩 𝘦𝘯𝘨𝘢𝘨𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘤𝘰𝘯𝘵𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘣𝘺 𝘴𝘶𝘣𝘴𝘤𝘳𝘪𝘣𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘰 𝗩𝗶𝘇𝘂𝗮𝗿𝗮’𝘀 𝗔𝗜 𝗡𝗲𝘄𝘀𝗹𝗲𝘁𝘁𝗲𝗿:

Retail Owners, struggling to hit your sales goals?

You can’t hit your sales goals without doing this one thing!

After 40+ Years in retail sales, I’ve uncovered this truth.

And it’s more important than you might think.

“Be smart about your sales targets.”

Here’s the reality:
Many retail businesses set ambitious sales goals without factoring in the realities of their business.

Imagine this:
You’ve just set an ambitious target for the quarter, but it doesn’t account for seasonality, your sales team’s historical performance, or key industry shifts.

By month two, you’re already falling short.

Sound familiar?

Here’s a better way:
1️. Account for Key Variables: Incorporate recurring revenue, product life cycles, and industry shifts into your forecast.

2️. Engage Your Team: Your sales reps have on-the-ground insights. Use them to set practical targets.

3️. Switch to Rolling Forecasts: Flexibility is key. Adjust as you go to tackle risks and seize new opportunities.

By embracing this data-driven approach, you’ll build momentum, boost morale, and drive sustainable growth.

I’ve helped retail owners reach their sales goals. Now it’s your turn!
It’s FREE, but slots are filling fast!
 Comment “READY” below, and I’ll send you a link to schedule a 𝗙𝗥𝗘𝗘 𝟯𝟬-𝗠𝗜𝗡𝗨𝗧𝗘 𝗖𝗢𝗡𝗦𝗨𝗟𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡 with me.

I often find myself so caught up in the race for success…

Right now, I'm hustling, pushing myself to grow, scale my business, and reach new heights.

And I know there are many out there doing the same and how in this journey every day feels like a race against time, where success is always at the forefront of my mind.

I'm achieving things I never thought possible, but there's something I sometimes forget... my people.

The celebrations will feel hollow. The achievements will feel incomplete.

So, if you're in the thick of your own journey like I am, take a moment to remember - It’s the people you surround yourself with that make success truly worth it.

To all my fellow hustlers - don’t forget to pause, look around, and cherish your tribe. ️

postsData.content:
My motivation and convictions for data protection and Europe’s digital sovereignty

I often hear the claim that I advocate for data protection and a sovereign Europe solely to promote my product. Today, I want to clarify this:

I am not a bandwagon jumper exploiting data protection as a trend or a unique selling point. Stackfield has existed as a company since 2012, and from day one, our goal has been clear: we are a privacy-first company.

Even in our first release, we integrated end-to-end encryption. In 2013, when Edward Snowden shook the world, we gained significant attention for this approach.

For us as a company and for me personally digital independence and protecting a country's data are top priorities. There are areas where I firmly believe that data must be so securely protected, on a technical level, that no other country can access it, regardless of their legal framework. These areas include government agencies, law firms, energy providers, banks, and the healthcare sector. Thousands of customers from precisely these industries already place their trust in us.

Some argue that Germany is no better than the USA. While that may be true in some respects, Germany will always prioritize the interests of its own citizens. And as citizens, we are bound solely by the laws of our country.

Do I personally use U.S.-based tools? Yes. We are all on platforms like LinkedIn, Instagram, and others, and I, too, use various tools to optimize my daily work with the help of AI.

But do we allow such tools within the Stackfield context in a way that could lead to customer data leaving the EU? Absolutely not! We also ensure that all subcontractors have no parent company in the U.S. In other words, no Azure, AWS, or similar platforms.

The truth is:

𝐈 𝐝𝐨 𝐧𝐨𝐭 𝐚𝐝𝐯𝐨𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐝𝐚𝐭𝐚 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐝𝐢𝐠𝐢𝐭𝐚𝐥 𝐬𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐢𝐠𝐧𝐭𝐲 𝐭𝐨 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐦𝐨𝐭𝐞 𝐦𝐲 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐧𝐲, 𝐈 𝐟𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐝 𝐒𝐭𝐚𝐜𝐤𝐟𝐢𝐞𝐥𝐝 𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐲 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐯𝐢𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧.

We live in a time where it is clearer than ever that every country prioritizes its own interests.

And in light of recent developments in the U.S., we are called upon more than ever to take our destiny into our own hands and put our country's interests first.

We can only achieve this by ensuring that we do not allow other countries to control our knowledge.

postsData.content:
Big Dreams Start with Small Steps





Have you ever looked at someone’s success and thought, “How did they get there?” Often, it’s not about giant leaps, but about small, consistent steps taken over time.




In a world that celebrates overnight success, it’s easy to overlook the power of persistence and daily effort. But here’s the truth: every big achievement is built on small, seemingly insignificant actions repeated consistently.



I remember a time when I doubted the value of what I was doing daily. The progress felt slow, and I wondered if it was worth it. But looking back now, I realize those small steps were the foundation for where I am today.



Maybe you're building a business, learning a skill, or chasing a dream that feels far away. It’s okay to feel overwhelmed—but don’t stop. Every email you send, every task you complete, and every effort you make is adding up in ways you might not see yet.



Success isn’t about perfection; it’s about progress. Trust the process, stay consistent, and remember that even the smallest steps forward are steps in the right direction.



Your future self will thank you for not giving up.



What’s one small step you’re taking today toward your dreams? Share it in the comments—I’d love to hear about your Journey

Big Data 🟥 Data Science | Machine Learning | Deep Learning | Artificial Intelligence
postsData.content:
BIOMIMICRY CONTINUUM – Part 4 – Update Agent LEARNING
Fundamental evidence of learning is the ability to recall and utilize what is learned. Receiving and integrating new information is a starting point. It is not learning, but an exceedingly small subset.
Recent research published in Nature uncovered that Concept Cells help our brain abstract information and build memories. (,)

A report in Quanta magazine () provides an example: The idea of a “bank” has its own set of concept cells, maybe millions of them. Concept neurons fire for their concept no matter how it is presented: in real life or a photo, in text or speech, on television or in a podcast. “It’s more abstract, really different from what you’re seeing,” said Elizabeth Buffalo, a neuroscientist at the University of Washington.

These discoveries support and align with the abstraction methodology discussed in Part 2 and the contextualization methodology in Part 3.



In contrast to how the brain learns, LLMs:
-process all ingested data rather than filtering for relevance, and
-output the detailed words and pixels based on statistical proximity rather than conceptual value
The aim is to pass the Turing test, output that imitates the appearance of intelligence sufficiently to deceive the user.

The correctness of the result is dependent on the concentrations of relevant data in the training content. AI speed hides the fact that the model does not “know” anything but rather recomputes even identical prompts.

On the other hand, by imitating the learning and memory architecture and methodology of the brain the Agentic Expertise Ecosystem creates a library of reusable expertise and continues to learn. Imagine the applications when expertise is in high demand but sparse due to "brain drain" scenarios, new science and technology, or economic constraints.

In part 5 I will discuss the curation methodology.
postsData.commentAdded: Fascinating insights on the learning process! Bridging neuroscience and AI opens doors for innovative expertise solutions. Excited for Part 5!

postsData.content:
5 mistakes sellers make in the final days of Q4:

1. Offering desperate discounts
↳ You kill your own commissions
↳ You destroy your pricing credibility
↳ You repel prospects with desperation

2. Pushing deals that aren't ready
↳ False commitments from buyers fall through
↳ You waste time that could go to better deals
↳ Closing without proper onboarding backfires

3. Living in your inbox
↳ Refreshing emails won't close deals faster
↳ You must pick up the phone to create urgency
↳ Don't settle on what you have in the pipe

4. Neglecting proper discovery
↳ Skipping steps leads to surprise objections
↳ Quality discovery = faster closing
↳ Slow down to speed up

5. Working alone
↳ Your entire team wants to help
↳ Leverage everybody for the final push
↳ Get together for closing week!

Here's what top performers do in the final days:

• Focus on real deals with pain & budget
• Multi-thread to speed up decisions
• Get executives involved early
• Plan for worst case scenarios
• Start building Q1 pipeline

End of quarter pressure is real.
But panic leads to bad decisions.

Stay focused on value.
The quota will follow.

What's your best Q4 closing tip?

️ Repost to help your sales team close the FY strong!
 Followfor daily tips to hit your quota

PS: Happy closing to all sellers who have their end of Q4 this week!

postsData.name:
Ari Harrison
Ari Harrison
postsData.content:
DeepSeek’s recent rise to the top of the App Store has been a defining moment. While some have called it a "surprise," those of us tracking AI advancements over the past 18 months know this was anything but. Chinese LLMs have consistently pushed boundaries, with models like Alibaba’s Qwen family leading the charge. When Qwen-2.5 launched in September 2024, it quickly became a benchmark for open-source excellence.

But what truly sets DeepSeek apart is its groundbreaking efficiency. DeepSeek v3 was trained on just 1,500 GPUs at a cost of $5.5 million—a fraction of what Western counterparts typically spend. This was made possible by architectural innovations like their advanced MoE (Mixture of Experts) framework, multi-headed latent attention, and cutting-edge quantization techniques (FP16 to FP8). These breakthroughs highlight how creativity can thrive even under constraints.

The U.S. chip export bans, initially seen as a setback, may have inadvertently accelerated innovation in China. By limiting access to compute resources, these restrictions forced a sharper focus on algorithmic and data efficiency. As the saying goes, *necessity is the mother of invention.*

So, what does this mean for the future of AI? A few thoughts:

1️⃣ Compute vs. Architecture: The narrative that compute is the ultimate differentiator in AI is shifting. As we approach the limits of scaling laws, architectural ingenuity—like DeepSeek’s—will likely take center stage. AI might be entering its own "compression era," where smarter, not bigger, models lead the way.

2️⃣ Impact on Chipmakers: While Nvidia’s stock has dipped recently, the long-term demand for GPUs remains strong. The majority of compute needs are already shifting toward inference, meaning smaller pretraining runs won’t drastically alter the market.

3️⃣ Open-Source Parity: For the first time, an open-source model (DeepSeek) has achieved near parity with closed-source giants. History shows that when open-source catches up, developers overwhelmingly flock to it. If this trend continues, DeepSeek could reshape global AI development, challenging U.S. leadership in the space.

4️⃣ A Win for Global AI: Beyond geopolitics, DeepSeek’s success is a testament to the power of innovation and collaboration. Their openness in sharing knowledge is a win for the entire AI community. Innovation knows no borders, and DeepSeek’s achievements deserve recognition without asterisks.

Kudos to the DeepSeek team for pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. I’m excited to see what they’ll do next—and how their work will inspire the next wave of AI breakthroughs.
postsData.commentAdded: Incredible insights! DeepSeek’s success showcases the power of innovation and collaboration in AI. Excited to see where this leads next! 🚀
